summary_points: 1. Packaging Corporation of America (PCA) agreed to acquire Greif, Inc.'s containerboard business for $1.8 billion in cash, with closing anticipated in the third quarter of 2025 or sooner, subject to customary conditions including antitrust approval.
2. The transaction is expected to close by June 30, 2026,  but this date is subject to two 90-day extensions under certain circumstances.
3.  The Purchase Agreement includes a termination fee payable by PCA to Seller if antitrust approval is not received.
1. Aon plc extended the term of Gregory C. Case's international assignment letter by one year, until June 30, 2026.

2.  Shareholders approved an amendment to the Aon plc 2011 Incentive Plan, increasing the maximum number of Class A Ordinary Shares available for issuance by 3,800,000 and mandating a minimum one-year vesting period for equity awards (with exceptions).
3. At Aon plc's Annual Meeting on June 27, 2025, 89.77% of the total shares entitled to vote were represented, and all eight proposals put to a vote were approved.
1. Dr. Richard Steeves, a Steris plc board director for 10 years, will retire from the board on July 31, 2025,  due to retirement and not any disagreement with the company.
2. This 8-K filing, dated July 3, 2025, reports on the departure of a director.
3.  No specific future impacts or risks are mentioned in this section of the filing.
